titleInfo.title: (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 7/27/11: Plaintiff's July 12, 2011 application to proceed in forma pauperis is granted 2. Service of the complaint is appropriate for defendants: Capt. S. Shannon, Warden Tim Virga, and Lieutenant J.A. Baker. The Clerk of the Court shall send plaintiff three USM-285 forms, one summons, an instruction sheet, and a copy of the complaint filed July 12, 2011. Within thirty days from the date of this order, plaintiff shall complete the Notice of Submission of Documents and submit it to the court. (Kaminski, H) Modified on 8/2/2011 (Kaminski, H).

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:11-cv-01826; (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 7/27/11: Plaintiff's July 12, 2011 application to proceed in forma pauperis is granted 2. Service of the complaint is appropriate for defendants: Capt. S. Shannon, Warden Tim Virga, and Lieutenant J.A. Baker. The Clerk of the Court shall send plaintiff three USM-285 forms, one summons, an instruction sheet, and a copy of the complaint filed July 12, 2011. Within thirty days from the date of this order, plaintiff shall complete the Notice of Submission of Documents and submit it to the court. (Kaminski, H) Modified on 8/2/2011 (Kaminski, H).

titleInfo.title: (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER DIRECTING MONTHLY PAYMENTS signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 7/27/11 ORDERING the director of the CDC to collect an initial partial filing fee of $1.50 and thereafter, forward payment from the prison trust account of Bruce Thorns to the clerk until the balance of $348.50 is paid in full. The clerk is directed to serve a copy of this order and the plaintiff's IFP on the Director of the CDC. The clerk is directed to serve a copy of this order on the financial department of the court. (cc Financial, CDC Prisoner Payment Orders ). (Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 6/8/12 plaintiffs March 12, 2012 motion to compel discovery 15 is DENIED; Defendants May 10, 2012 motion to modify the scheduling order 18 is GRANTED; The May 11, 2012 deadline for the filing of pretrial motions, except motions to compel, is vacated and reset to 30 days from the date of this order.(Dillon, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 09/19/12 ordering plaintiff is granted 30 days from the date of this order in which to file and serve a supplemental opposition to defendants' 06/11/12 motion for summary judgment, or in the alternative, plaintiff shall file a notice informing the court that he does not intend to file any supplemental opposition. Defendants may file a supplemental reply not later than 14 days after service of any supplemental opposition. (Plummer, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:11-cv-01826; (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 09/19/12 ordering plaintiff is granted 30 days from the date of this order in which to file and serve a supplemental opposition to defendants' 06/11/12 motion for summary judgment, or in the alternative, plaintiff shall file a notice informing the court that he does not intend to file any supplemental opposition. Defendants may file a supplemental reply not later than 14 days after service of any supplemental opposition. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 10/24/12 granting 30 Motion for Extension of time. Plaintiff is granted 45 days from the date of this order to file and serve a supplemental opposition to the defendants motion for summary judgment. No further extensions of time will be granted. Plaintiff's 10/22/12 request for a copy of defendants points and authorities in support of their motion for summary judgment 31 is granted. Within 7 days from the date of this order defendants shall re-serve plaintiff a copy of their points and authorities in support of their motion for summary judgment. (Plummer, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:11-cv-01826; (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al;

extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 10/24/12 granting 30 Motion for Extension of time. Plaintiff is granted 45 days from the date of this order to file and serve a supplemental opposition to the defendants motion for summary judgment. No further extensions of time will be granted. Plaintiff's 10/22/12 request for a copy of defendants points and authorities in support of their motion for summary judgment 31 is granted. Within 7 days from the date of this order defendants shall re-serve plaintiff a copy of their points and authorities in support of their motion for summary judgment. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Dale A. Drozd on 02/27/13 recommending that defendants' 06/11/12 motion for summary judgment 21 be granted as to plaintiff's claim that his constitutional right to equal protection under the laws was violated. Plaintiff be granted leave to file an amended complaint to attempt to allege the other constitutional claims, if any, he wishes to pursue against defendants Virga, Shannon and Baker. MOTION for SUMMARY JUDGMENT 21 referred to Judge Morrison C. England Jr. Objections due within 14 days. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Thorns v. Shannon et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER adopting in full 43 FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS, signed by Chief Judge Morrison C. England, Jr., on 3/27/13. Defendants' 21 Motion for Summary Judgment is GRANTED as to Plaintiff's claim that his constitutional right to equal protection under the laws was violated. Plaintiff is GRANTED leave to file an amended complaint to attempt to allege the other constitutional claims, if any, he wishes to pursue against Defendants Virga, Shannon and Baker. (Kastilahn, A)
